definitions: The internal organ in which the major part of the digestion of food occurs, being (in humans and many mammals) a pear-shaped enlargement of the alimentary canal linking the oesophagus to the small intestine.
Each of four stomachs in a ruminant (the rumen, reticulum, omasum, and abomasum).
Any of a number of organs analogous to the stomach in lower animals.
The front part of the body between the chest and thighs; the belly.
The stomach viewed as the seat of hunger, nausea, anxiety, or other unsettling feelings.
An appetite for food or drink.
A desire or inclination for something involving conflict or difficulty.
